title: 110_hr6144
content: The Act may be cited as the "Teacher Education Assistance Creating Hope for Our Future Act of 2008" or the "TEACH for Our Future Act of 2008". Loan forgiveness for teachers under the FFEL Program is included in the Act. Section 428J of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to authorize a program for loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive years at a public or private school. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to allow for loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive years at a qualifying school and are not in default on a loan. The borrower seeks forgiveness under the Higher Education Act of 1965 for teachers who have completed five years of full-time teaching at a qualifying school. The Secretary may repay up to $25,000 for certain borrowers and up to $5,000 for others. In subsection (g), amendments are made to paragraphs (1)(A) and (3) by updating subsection references. SEC. 3. DIRECT LOAN PROGRAM LOAN FORGIVENESS FOR TEACHERS. Section 460 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have been employed full-time at a public or private school for 5 consecutive years. Teachers who have worked full-time at a qualifying school for 5 consecutive years and are not in default on a loan may be eligible for loan forgiveness. The borrower seeks forgiveness for a Federal Direct Stafford Loan or a Federal Direct Unsubsidized Stafford Loan after completing five years of teaching. The Secretary may cancel up to $25,000 for certain borrowers and up to $5,000 for others. In subsection (g), amendments are made to paragraphs regarding loan forgiveness for teachers completing five years of service. Amendments include changes to subsection (b)(1) references.
